abstract: World Health Organization, responding to criticism of slow and ineffective action on Ebola epidemic, backs changes to fortify its emergency response to outbreaks and other health crises.
lead_paragraph: Key provisions include creating a global cadre of emergency health workers, establishing a fund that could be tapped quickly, and support for the development of treatments for emerging infectious diseases.
snippet: Key provisions include creating a global cadre of emergency health workers, establishing a fund that could be tapped quickly, and support for the development of treatments for emerging infectious diseases.

headline.main: W.H.O. Members Endorse Resolution to Improve Response to Health Emergencies
headline.print_headline: Criticized on Ebola, U.N. Agency Backs Changes to Improve Its Emergency Response
